ogTitle: cdc on an increasingly serious salmonella outbreak impacting 43 u.s. states including red, white, yellow, & sweet onions. - smarther news
ogDescription: if you can’t tell where your onions are from, don’t eat them. throw them away.
quote: If you can’t tell where your onions are from, don’t eat them. Throw them away.
summary: CDC on an increasingly serious salmonella outbreak impacting 43 U.S. states including red, white, yellow, & sweet onions.
body:
• Here’s the alert from the CDC so you can check your refrigerator or prepped food items: CLICK HERE
  • Salmonella, a bacteria, causes stomach upset 6 hours to 6 days after you eat a contaminated item.
  • The number of cases has grown to more than 600; no deaths reported as of August 10th.
  • WHY IT MATTERS: The number of states including in the outbreak has increased over the last several weeks. “If you don’t know where your onions are from, don’t eat, serve, or sell them or any food prepared with them.”
  • Here’s a map of the outbreak
